Hello Danylo,

--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com]
Sent: 9/4/2024 8:42 PM
To: danylo.d@corewin.ua
Subject: Gray icon beside Device in the EPP client UI [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0FJJSv:ref ]

Hello Danylo,

The customer can try to access Device Control -> Devices -> Filter for last computer -> look for the device in cause -> click on the actions button on the right side of the device -> Manage rights -> set the allow access for the device for the computer and user.
This way the device will be allowed.
If it does not work, let me know and we can schedule a remote session in order to investigate further.

Best regards,
Emil

Hello Danylo,

I wanted to check in regarding your support ticket 00419963. We haven’t heard from you in a while, and I just wanted to see if you still need assistance with this issue.

If you’re still experiencing problems or have any updates to share, please let me know. If the issue has been resolved, I can go ahead and close the ticket on my end.

Please feel free to reply to this email with any updates or questions. We’re here to help you get the most out of your Netwrix products.

Ticket Number: 00419963
Ticket Subject: Gray icon beside Device in the EPP client UI
Ticket Details: Hello,

Customer name is PrivatBank.
They reported that on Computer, where a specific device was Allowed to connect a few months ago, and it worked well until last month.
For some reason, the device started blocking on this PC and the connection icon in the EPP client UI is gray color.
If user track mouse to this icon it says "Device Disconnected" but actually this device is plugged to the computer.
The device type is USB disk drive.
Can you please clarify why it could happen?

Screenshots will be attached here.

Thank you!

Emil Podar
Technical Support Engineer
